esv_text: 1 In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
bcn_text: 1 Er penn-kentañ e krouas Doue an neñvoù hag an douar.

esv_text: 2 And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.
bcn_text: 2 An douar a oa deuet dizoare ha goullo, an deñvalijenn a oa war-c'horre an donder, ha Spered Doue a fiñve dreist an doureier.

esv_text: 3 And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
bcn_text: 3 Doue a lavaras: Ra vo ar sklêrijenn. Hag ar sklêrijenn a voe.

esv_text: 4 And God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.
bcn_text: 4 Doue a welas e oa mat ar sklêrijenn, ha Doue a zispartias ar sklêrijenn diouzh an deñvalijenn.

esv_text: 5 And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.
bcn_text: 5 Doue a c'halvas ar sklêrijenn deiz, hag an deñvalijenn noz. Hag un abardaez, hag ur beure, a voe an deiz kentañ.

esv_text: 6 And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.
bcn_text: 6 Doue a lavaras: Ra vo un astennidigezh etre an doureier, ma tispartio an doureier diouzh an doureier.

esv_text: 7 And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.
bcn_text: 7 Doue a reas an astennidigezh hag a zispartias an doureier a zo dindan an astennidigezh diouzh ar re a zo dreist an astennidigezh. Hag evel-se e voe.

esv_text: 8 And God called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.
bcn_text: 8 Doue a c'halvas an astennidigezh neñvoù. Hag un abardaez, hag ur beure, a voe an eil deiz.

esv_text: 9 And God said, Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.
bcn_text: 9 Doue a lavaras: Ra en em zastumo an doureier a zo dindan an neñvoù en ul lec'h hepken, ma en em ziskouezo ar sec'h. Hag evel-se e voe.

esv_text: 10 And God called the dry land Earth; and the gathering together of the waters called he Seas: and God saw that it was good.
bcn_text: 10 Doue a c'halvas ar sec'h douar, ha dastumadeg an doureier morioù. Doue a welas e oa mat kement-se.

esv_text: 11 And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.
bcn_text: 11 Doue a lavaras: Ra broduo an douar glasvez, geot o tougen had, gwez-frouezh o tougen o frouezh hervez o rumm hag o devo o had enno o-unan war an douar. Hag evel-se e voe.

esv_text: 12 And the earth brought forth grass, and herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed was in itself, after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
bcn_text: 12 An douar a broduas glasvez, geot o tougen o had hervez o rumm, gwez o tougen frouezh hag o doa o had enno o-unan hervez o rumm. Doue a welas e oa mat kement-se.

esv_text: 13 And the evening and the morning were the third day.
bcn_text: 13 Hag un abardaez, hag ur beure, a voe an trede deiz.

esv_text: 14 And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years:
bcn_text: 14 Doue a lavaras: Ra vo goulaouennoù en astennidigezh an neñvoù evit dispartiañ an deiz diouzh an noz; ra vint sinoù evit an amzerioù, evit an deizioù hag evit ar bloavezhioù;

esv_text: 15 and let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.
bcn_text: 15 ra vint goulaouennoù en astennidigezh an neñvoù evit sklêrijennañ an douar. Hag evel-se e voe.

esv_text: 16 And God made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also.
bcn_text: 16 Doue a reas an div c'houlaouenn vras: ar c'houlaouenn vrasañ evit ren war an deiz, hag ar c'houlaouenn vihanañ evit ren war an noz. Ober a reas ivez ar stered.

esv_text: 17 And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,
bcn_text: 17 Doue a lakaas anezho en astennidigezh an neñvoù evit sklêrijennañ an douar,

esv_text: 18 and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and God saw that it was good.
bcn_text: 18 evit ren war an deiz ha war an noz, hag evit dispartiañ ar sklêrijenn diouzh an deñvalijenn. Doue a welas e oa mat kement-se.

esv_text: 19 And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.
bcn_text: 19 Hag un abardaez, hag ur beure, a voe ar pevare deiz.

esv_text: 20 And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.
bcn_text: 20 Doue a lavaras: Ra broduo an doureier boudoù bev a-fonn, ha ra nijo laboused a-us d'an douar war-zu astennidigezh an neñvoù.

esv_text: 21 And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
bcn_text: 21 Doue a grouas ar pesked bras hag an holl voudoù bev a fiñv a broduas an doureier gant fonnder hervez o rumm, ha pep labous askellek hervez e rumm. Doue a welas e oa mat kement-se.

esv_text: 22 And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.
bcn_text: 22 Doue o bennigas, o lavarout: Bezit frouezhus, kreskit ha leugnit doureier ar morioù, ha ra gresko al laboused war an douar.

esv_text: 23 And the evening and the morning were the fifth day.
bcn_text: 23 Hag un abardaez, hag ur beure, a voe ar pempvet deiz.

esv_text: 24 And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.
bcn_text: 24 Doue a lavaras: Ra broduo an douar boudoù bev hervez o rumm, chatal, stlejviled hag anevaled douarek hervez o rumm. Hag evel-se e voe.

esv_text: 25 And God made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
bcn_text: 25 Doue a reas anevaled an douar hervez o rumm, ar chatal hervez e rumm hag holl stlejviled an douar hervez o rumm. Doue a welas e oa mat kement-se.

esv_text: 26 And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.
bcn_text: 26 Doue a lavaras: Greomp an den en hor skeudenn, hervez hon heñveledigezh, ha ra reno war besked ar mor, war laboused an neñvoù, war ar chatal, war an douar holl ha war an holl stlejviled a ruz war an douar.

esv_text: 27 So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.
bcn_text: 27 Doue a grouas an den en e skeudenn, e grouiñ a reas e skeudenn Doue; krouiñ a reas ur gwaz hag ur vaouez.

esv_text: 28 And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.
bcn_text: 28 Doue o bennigas ha Doue a lavaras: Bezit frouezhus, kreskit, leugnit an douar ha mestrognit anezhañ, renit war besked ar mor, war laboused an neñvoù ha war gement aneval a fiñv war an douar.

esv_text: 29 And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.
bcn_text: 29 Ha Doue a lavaras: Setu, roet em eus deoc'h pep geotenn o tougen had a zo war-c'horre an douar holl, ha pep gwezenn he deus enni frouezh gwezenn o tougen had: kement-se a vo ho poued.

esv_text: 30 And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.
bcn_text: 30 Da holl loened an douar, da holl laboused an neñvoù, da gement a fiñv war an douar hag en deus ennañ un ene bev, em eus roet pep geotenn c'hlas evit boued. Hag evel-se e voe.

esv_text: 31 And God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.
bcn_text: 31 Doue a welas kement en doa graet ha setu, e oa mat-meurbet. Hag un abardaez, hag ur beure, a voe ar c'hwec'hvet deiz.

esv_text: 1 Now these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt; every man and his household came with Jacob.
bcn_text: 1 Setu anvioù mibien Israel a zeuas en Ejipt gant Jakob. Dont a rejont pep hini gant e diegezh.

esv_text: 2 Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,
bcn_text: 2 Ruben, Simeon, Levi, Juda,

esv_text: 3 Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,
bcn_text: 3 Isakar, Zabulon, Benjamin,

esv_text: 4 Dan, and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
bcn_text: 4 Dan, Neftali, Gad hag Aser.

esv_text: 5 And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: for Joseph was in Egypt already .
bcn_text: 5 An holl dud o tiskenn eus Jakob a oa dek ha tri-ugent. Jozef a oa en Ejipt.

esv_text: 6 And Joseph died, and all his brethren, and all that generation.
bcn_text: 6 Jozef a varvas, hag e holl vreudeur hag an holl rumm-se ivez.

esv_text: 7 And the children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them.
bcn_text: 7 Mibien Israel a voe frouezhus hag a greskas. Dont a rejont da vezañ niverusoc'h-niverusañ ha galloudusoc'h-galloudusañ, hag ar vro a voe leun ganto.

esv_text: 8 Now there arose up a new king over Egypt, which knew not Joseph.
bcn_text: 8 Sevel a reas war an Ejipt ur roue nevez n'en doa ket anavezet Jozef.

esv_text: 9 And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we:
bcn_text: 9 Lavarout a reas d'e bobl: Setu, pobl mibien Israel a zo brasoc'h ha galloudusoc'h egedomp.

esv_text: 10 come on, let us deal wisely with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they join also unto our enemies, and fight against us, and so get them up out of the land.
bcn_text: 10 Deomp! Bezomp fur en o c'heñver gant aon na greskfent ha, ma en em gavfe ur brezel bennak, na unanfent gant hon enebourien, na vrezelfent a-enep deomp ha na'z afent er-maez eus ar vro.

esv_text: 11 Therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh treasure cities, Pithom and Raamses.
bcn_text: 11 Lakaat a rejont eta warno mistri-anerioù evit o bec'hiañ gant trevelloù. Evel-se e savjont da Faraon kêrioù Pitom ha Ramsez, evel dastumlec'hioù.

esv_text: 12 But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. And they were grieved because of the children of Israel.
bcn_text: 12 Met mui e vec'hient anezho, mui e kreskent hag e fonnent, hag o doe digarantez ouzh mibien Israel.

esv_text: 13 And the Egyptians made the children of Israel to serve with rigour:
bcn_text: 13 Gant rustoni, an Ejipsianed a lakaas mibien Israel da vezañ sklaved,

esv_text: 14 and they made their lives bitter with hard bondage, in morter, and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field: all their service, wherein they made them serve, was with rigour.
bcn_text: 14 hag e lakajont o buhez da vezañ c'hwerv dre ul labour start gant pri ha brik, ha dre bep seurt labourioù ar maezioù. Al labourioù-se a lakaent anezho d'ober gant krizderi.

esv_text: 15 And the king of Egypt spake to the Hebrew midwives, of which the name of the one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah:
bcn_text: 15 Roue an Ejipt a gomzas da amiegezed an Hebreed, a oa anv unan Shifra hag anv eben Pua .

esv_text: 16 and he said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them upon the stools; if it be a son, then ye shall kill him: but if it be a daughter, then she shall live.
bcn_text: 16 Lavarout a reas: Pa wilioudot gwragez an Hebreed ha pa welot anezho war an azezoù, mard eo ur mab, e lazhot anezhañ, mard eo ur plac'h, e lezot anezhi da vevañ.

esv_text: 17 But the midwives feared God, and did not as the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the men children alive.
bcn_text: 17 Met an amiegezed a zoujas Doue ha ne rejont ket ar pezh en doa lavaret roue an Ejipt dezho, hag e lezjont ar baotred da vevañ.

esv_text: 18 And the king of Egypt called for the midwives, and said unto them, Why have ye done this thing, and have saved the men children alive?
bcn_text: 18 Roue an Ejipt a c'halvas an amiegezed hag a lavaras: Perak hoc'h eus graet evel-se, hag hoc'h eus lezet ar baotred da vevañ?

esv_text: 19 And the midwives said unto Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not as the Egyptian women; for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwives come in unto them.
bcn_text: 19 An amiegezed a respontas da Faraon: N'eo ket gwragez an Hebreed evel an Ejipsianezed; int a zo nerzhus, a-raok ma en em gav an amiegez en o c'hichen, o devez gwilioudet.

esv_text: 20 Therefore God dealt well with the midwives: and the people multiplied, and waxed very mighty.
bcn_text: 20 Doue a reas vad d'an amiegezed, hag ar bobl a greskas hag a zeuas gwall niverus.

esv_text: 21 And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God, that he made them houses.
bcn_text: 21 Dre m'o doa doujet an amiegezed Doue, e roas dezho tiegezhioù.

esv_text: 22 And Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river, and every daughter ye shall save alive.
bcn_text: 22 Neuze Faraon a roas an urzh-mañ d'e holl bobl: Taolit er stêr an holl vibien a c'hano, met lezit da vevañ an holl verc'hed.
